contextId.information: AT: "the people of Judah have been taken into a foreign land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
She is the kingdom of Judah who is described as a woman. She also stands for the citizens of Judah. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here the word "hand" refers to the army of the enemy. AT: "When the adversary conquered and captured her people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: When her people fell into the hand of the adversary

contextId.information: Here "horn" (that is, an animal horn) stands for "strength." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: he has cut off every horn of Israel

contextId.information: ways in which people make fun of others and insult them (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: clap their hands ... hiss and shake their heads

contextId.information: Here "horn" (that is, an animal horn) often stands for strength. AT: "he has increased the power of your enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: he has lifted up the horn of your enemies

contextId.information: AT: "God decrees disaster or success for every person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Is it not from the mouth of the Most High that both calamities and the good come?

contextId.information: AT: "What I see causes me much pain" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
AT: "I called to you for help" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
AT: "The words that those who rise up against me spoke" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: The lips of those who rise up against me
no one lifted a hand to help her

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) "We no longer wear flowers on our heads for celebrations" or 2) "We no longer have a king." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: The crown has fallen from our head
